1.name: Introduction
1.title: Introduction to GitGate
description: You arrive at a large wooden house, seemingly abandoned. The roof seems to be caving in and the walls are vanadlised with holes and graffiti. Your friend Vicky has requested you to come with her for a special mission. You didn't think much of it but decided to come because she's your friend. But when Vicky opens the door to the house, a pristine looking time machine stands tall in front of you.
"Did you remember to pack your bags and paperwork?" she asked as she checked her own.
1.hint: Click on the files to enable edit mode and view their contents. You can save any changes or cancel changes.

files.name: Backpack
files.content:
- Toothpaste
- Toothbrush
- Flashlight
- Compass
- Water
- Clothes

files.content:
TIME TRAVEL FORM
Name:Vicky
Age:17
Destination:???
Reasons for time travel:
1. Find the legendary Spudcalibur
2. Play Yu-Gi-Oh in Ancient Egypt
3. Have fun

files.name: Travel Form.txt
files.content:
TIME TRAVEL FORM
Name: 
Age: 
Destination: 
Reasons for time travel:
1. 
2. 
3.

2.name: Backups
2.title: Making Backups
description: Now that the two of you have your paperwork and backpacks, you are ready to start your journey! Vicky heads into the time machine first, you following in quite closely. Your eyes swirl as the material realm starts to disappear, only to reappear a few moments later.

Instead of heading back in time, you seemed to be at a large establishment. "Hey, let's go! This is the university I was telling you about. We need to get our time travelling licences before we can travel." she reassured you.
Though as you start to follow Vicky, you pull out your travel form... or at least half of it. Unlike you, it didn't seem to have survived the journey.
2.hint: Make lots of copies of your travel form so you don't have to fill one in from the beginning again.
2.task: Edit and save your final form.

3.name: LS
3.title: Laying it all out.
description: Once you got past the gates, and the teacher's mean eyes, with your several different forms, Vicky insisted on finding the vacation board. It wasn't long before you were face to face with a large board with pictures of different exotic spots. Where would you go?
3.hint: Now it's time to explore the terminal! Type in 'ls' and see what happens.

4.name: Touch
4.title: Creation
description: Though going on holiday would be nice, you won't be going anywhere anytime soon if you don't get your licence. You and Vicky ended up with different classes, so you bid her farewell as you went to your own class.
As you enter your classroom, you take your seat. A few moments later, you notice how small the class is. Time travel must be not too popular.

"Quiet everyone, today's lesson is on creation and destruction. Time travelling essentially creates a new space in time. So when you travel, you are creating a new timeline that you partially control."
4.hint: Use the command touch to create a new timeline. For example, touch textFile.txt.

5.name: Remove
5.title: Destruction
description: "Good job!" Your teacher gave you a gold star for your efforts. Though as your timeline slowly fizzles out of existence, the kid next to you doesn't seem to be succeeding so well. He seems to have lost control of his creation and requires your help now.
5.hint: Use the command rm to destroy a timeline.

files.name: Out of control timeline
files.content: Narnia, a land of talking animals and mythical creatures that is ruled by the evil White Witch.

6.name: Initialising
6.title: Getting Started
description: After you snuffed out the timeline, the class erupted in applause! The teacher was proud of your ability and decided that perhaps you're ready to get started with some more practical lessons. She asks you to follow her as she takes you out of the classroom, down a corridor and into an even smaller room!
"Oooh hey there! Nice to see you catching up with me." Vicky said with a smirk. She must've started off in this class, slightly ahead of you in time travelling education. But you'll catch up soon.
"Okay students, would someone like to help our new student with starting their own machine?"
6.hint: Before you can use a git repository, you must initialise it. This means the same as creating a repository.

7.name: Git Name
7.title: Introducing yourself
description: Now that you've started up your time machine, the gears started whirring up as electricity is spat through the thick rubber cased wires. It's not long before the whirring eventually settles down however, leaving a gentle hum in the room.
After what felt like forever, a robotic voice suddenly made itself known! "Hello there master! I'm your trusty time machine. You can give me a name but please call me Dr Rahul. What is your name?"
7.hint: Whenever you work in a new environment, you need to let your computer know who is working on the repository. Usually it's your username such as your GitHub username, but feel free to let it be whatever you want this time. The command is a bit complex: git config --global user.name.

8.name: Git Email
8.title: Networking with Inanimateness
description: Now that you've submitted your name, the time machine wants to send your a confirmation email to your email address to make sure no one can steal your time machine. Please submit an email address.
8.hint: Same as before, but adapt the command for email instead of a name. It doesn't have to be a real email, I won't be checking. And you can check your email and username by entering 'git details'.

9.name: Git Add
9.title: Staging your changes
description: Now that you've submitted your name and email to your time machine, your time machine wants to treasure it! They wouldn't want to forget who you are after all! In the past, when you lost your travel form and needed to create multiple copies, you were kepeing your data safe but it was very inefficient. That's where Git comes in!

Staging is a step in the process of saving changes to your code using Git. Before you actually save your changes, you need to tell Git which changes you want to save. This is where the staging area comes in - it's a space where you can select which changes to include in your next commit.
9.hint: Use git add to add a file to staging. But it has to be a file that has been added or edited, there's no point in staging a file that hasn't changed.
9.task: Edit and add at least one file to the staging area.

files.name: Banana
files.content: A sweet, yellow fruit that is high in potassium and other essential vitamins and minerals.

files.name: Mount Everest
files.content: The highest mountain in the world, located in the Himalayas, with an elevation of 29,032 feet.

files.name: Soccer
files.content: A popular team sport played with a round ball, where players kick the ball into the opposing team's goal to score points.

files.name: The Mona Lisa
files.content: A famous portrait painting by Leonardo da Vinci, created in the 16th century, that depicts a woman with a mysterious smile.

files.name: Eiffel Tower
files.content: A landmark monument located in Paris, France, that was built in 1889 for the World's Fair and is now a popular tourist attraction.

10.name: Git Commit
10.title: Committing your changes
description: Your time machine wants to also confirm some of your favourite media, could you edit the files to fit your preferences before adding the files to the staging area? Then once you add it to the staging area, you can create a commit. This commit is like a small box that is closed tight once you commit it, and this is the box you'll be pushing to the cloud.
10.hint: You can use git commit -m "message" to commit your files.
10.task: Commit files from the staging file into a commit.

11.name: Sandbox Mode
11.title: Sandbox Mode
description: This is a place for you to practice various different commands and get an idea of how they work.

91.name: Tamago Trio
91.title: Ooof
description: Despacito
91.hint: JUST DO IT, DON'T LET YOUR MEMES BE DREAMS!
